Recent CRISPR‑based strategies have markedly improved plant disease resistance. Lee and Kim (2023) demonstrated that CRISPR‑Cas9 knockout of *SlLr* genes confers strong resistance to bacterial wilt in tomato. Kumar and Patel (2022) reported that multiplex editing of three susceptibility genes reduces powdery mildew severity in wheat by 85%, highlighting the power of simultaneous target disruption. Nguyen and Li (2024) employed cytidine base editing to introduce point mutations that mimic natural resistance alleles, achieving durable blast resistance in rice without creating double‑strand breaks.
